domain_matching.finding: Molecular pre-training shows strong negative transfer to citation networks
domain_matching.recommendation: Pre-train on domain-similar data or use domain adaptation techniques

task_selection.finding: Simple single-task schemes often outperform complex multi-task combinations
task_selection.evidence: Best scheme (b2) uses only node feature masking, while complex schemes (s4, s5) show worse performance
task_selection.recommendation: Start with single-task pre-training; add tasks only with demonstrated synergy

feature_alignment.finding: Feature dimension mismatch (3-37 → 1433-3703) severely impacts transfer
feature_alignment.evidence: Citation networks with 100x higher dimensions show consistent negative transfer
feature_alignment.recommendation: Use feature projection or dimension-aware architectures for cross-domain transfer

efficiency_considerations.finding: Linear probing often sufficient for well-aligned domains
efficiency_considerations.evidence: Full fine-tuning provides marginal gains at 10x computational cost
efficiency_considerations.recommendation: Use linear probing for initial evaluation; full fine-tuning only when necessary

gradient_surgery.finding: PCGrad helps but doesn't fully resolve multi-task conflicts
gradient_surgery.evidence: Performance degrades with more tasks despite gradient surgery
gradient_surgery.recommendation: Carefully curate task combinations; more tasks ≠ better performance
